data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Vileplume-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fragrant Flower Garden
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Massive Bloom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Allergic Explosion-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Sunflora
data.flavorText: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this Pokémon's face become more vivid and lively.

attacks.name: Solar Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, ignore all Energy in the attack costs of Grass Pokémon and Fire Pokémon. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.)

data.name: Sunkern
data.flavorText: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

attacks.name: Riled Horn
attacks.text: If your opponent has any TAG TEAM Pokémon in play, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Lileep
data.flavorText: In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It disguised itself as seaweed to ambush its prey and devoured them whole when they got close.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cradily
data.flavorText: Normally, it lived on shallow sea shoals. When the tide went out, this Pokémon came up on land to search for prey.

abilities.name: Swaying Strangle
abilities.text: Your opponent's Pokémon that are affected by Special Conditions can't retreat.

attacks.name: Poison Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: The bunches of fruit growing around the necks of Tropius in Alola are especially sweet compared to those in other regions.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kricketot
data.flavorText: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

data.name: Sawsbuck
data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

abilities.name: Seasonal Blessings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Kricketune
data.flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

attacks.name: Improvisational Performance
attacks.text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Hide and Seek
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Buzzwole
data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

abilities.name: Beast Boost
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Decidueye
data.flavorText: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can't afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tracking Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Charizard & Braixen-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Flare
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crimson Flame Pillar-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: If it inhales deeply, that's a sign it's about to attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!

abilities.name: Power Cheer
abilities.text: The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Power Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: You can tell how it's feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.

attacks.name: Fire Fling
attacks.text: Put 4 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Pignite
data.flavorText: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

abilities.name: Victory Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Emboar
data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

abilities.name: Explosive Fire Dance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: When they're young, they live with a pride. Once they're able to hunt prey on their own, they're kicked out and have to make their own way.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Volcarona-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flaming Shot
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Massive Heat Wave-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pyroar
data.flavorText: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

attacks.name: Swirling Inferno
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards and Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.

abilities.name: Snowed In
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

abilities.name: Vitality Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Wailord
data.flavorText: They eat so many fish Pokémon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Glalie
data.flavorText: It freezes its prey and chews them whole. However, it prefers to eat Pokémon like Vanillite that are already frozen.

attacks.name: Ice Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and discard an Energy from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Frosty Typhoon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Frosty Typhoon during your next turn.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Walrein
data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Cold Snap
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn. If 1 of your Pokémon used Cold Snap during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

data.name: Prinplup
data.flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

attacks.name: Direct Dive
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Empoleon
data.flavorText: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

attacks.name: Recall
attacks.text: Choose an attack from 1 of this Pokémon's previous Evolutions and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Aquafall
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Phione
data.flavorText: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

abilities.name: Whirlpool Suction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. If you do, discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and put it on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

attacks.name: High Water
attacks.text: Attach 2 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swirling Waves
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

attacks.name: Bubble Hold
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Wishiwashi
data.flavorText: Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name "demon of the sea."

abilities.name: Scatter
abilities.text: At the end of your opponent's turn, if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If tails, shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Swanna
data.flavorText: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

attacks.name: Tailwind
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Black Kyurem
data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dazzling Blizzard
attacks.text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Wishiwashi-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: School Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Wishiwashi and Wishiwashi-GX in play.

attacks.name: Massive Catch-GX
attacks.text: Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.

attacks.name: Liquidation
attacks.text: During your next turn, the Defending Pokémon takes 60 more damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Powerful Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.

abilities.name: Call Signal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to 3 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.

abilities.name: Speed Cheer
abilities.text: The attacks of your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee cost Colorless less. You can't apply more than 1 Speed Cheer Ability at a time.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn's bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.

abilities.name: Blinking Lights
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Swirling Flow
attacks.text: You may have your opponent shuffle their deck.

data.name: Togedemaru
data.flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Togedemaru
data.flavorText: When it's surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cosmic Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Protector-GX
attacks.text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Balloon Burst
attacks.text: Discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: Although it still can't fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: It's said that while this Pokémon has the power to predict the future, it's not powerful enough to change the future it sees.

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.name: Duskull
data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

abilities.name: Spiritborne Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Dusclops
data.flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Dusknoir
data.flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

abilities.name: Grim Marking
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

attacks.name: Nasal Suction
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

data.name: Swoobat
data.flavorText: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Charming Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses 1 of their own Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: Some say that ancient people invented Golurk to serve as a laborer. It follows its master's orders faithfully.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fist of Antiquity
attacks.text: If you have any Supporter cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Skrelp
data.flavorText: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Dragalge
data.flavorText: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.

attacks.name: Poison Cultivation
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It's trying to make friends with them.

data.name: Trevenant
data.flavorText: It's feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.

attacks.name: Perplexing Forest
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Mimikyu
data.flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.

attacks.name: Impersonation
attacks.text: Discard a Supporter card from your hand. If you do, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Mischievous Hands
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

data.name: Oricorio-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dance of Tribute
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Strafe-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lunala
data.flavorText: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name "the beast that calls the moon."

abilities.name: Blessing of the Moone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Solgaleo in play, you may search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to your Solgaleo or Lunala in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dhelmise
data.flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

attacks.name: Seaweed Grab
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Mimikyu
data.flavorText: Although it's a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what's under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.

abilities.name: Shadow Box
abilities.text: Pokémon-GX that have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cosmoem
data.flavorText: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the "cocoon of the stars" and built an altar to worship it.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Put an Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Trapinch
data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

attacks.name: Nest Building
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Marshadow
data.flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.

attacks.name: Shadow Imitation
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's non-GX attacks and use it as this attack.

data.name: Blacephalon
data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

attacks.name: Fireworks Bomb
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.

data.name: Nosepass
data.flavorText: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it's in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.

attacks.name: Draw Toward
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.name: Trapinch
data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Vibrava
data.flavorText: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.

abilities.name: Obnoxious Whirring
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Flygon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dusty Defense
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, all of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Desert Hurricane
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 120 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge-GX
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Anorith
data.flavorText: When restored Anorith are released into the ocean, they don't thrive, because the water composition has changed since their era.

data.name: Armaldo
data.flavorText: It lived on land and went out into the sea to hunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its greatest weapon.

attacks.name: Ancient Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil card in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Groudon
data.flavorText: Said to have expanded the lands by evaporating water with raging heat. It battled titanically with Kyogre.

attacks.name: Drought
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Fighting Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trembling Ground
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Trembling Ground during your next turn.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.

attacks.name: Drill Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Crabominable
data.flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Freezing Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Throh
data.flavorText: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

attacks.name: Reverse Shoulder Throw
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.flavorText: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

abilities.name: Bulldoze
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Tremulous Fist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

data.name: Lycanroc
data.flavorText: It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn't like. It doesn't seem to mind getting hurt at all—as long as it can finish off its opponent.

abilities.name: Boiling Blood
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Voltage Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Passimian
data.flavorText: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Palossand
data.flavorText: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they're still alive.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Alolan Meowth
data.flavorText: It's impulsive, selfish, and fickle. It's very popular with some Trainers who like giving it the attention it needs.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Persian-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Smug Face
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's TAG TEAM Pokémon and Ultra Beasts, and by your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Stalking Claws-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Grimer
data.flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: The only thing unlucky about Absol is its appearance. It protects fields and warns people of disaster, so one ought to be grateful for it.

attacks.name: Ominous News
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dirty Throw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Sandygast
data.flavorText: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Alolan Muk
data.flavorText: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades on a stone by the river. Each Pawniard has its own favorite sharpening stone.

attacks.name: Bag Slash
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard an Item card you find there.

data.name: Probopass
data.flavorText: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don't come back.

attacks.name: Hard Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Guzzlord
data.flavorText: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Red Banquet
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew
data.flavorText: After fleeing a volcanic eruption, it ended up moving to an area of snowy mountains. Its ice shell is as hard as steel.

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rolling Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Supreme Puff-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokémon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Solgaleo
data.flavorText: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.

abilities.name: Armor of the Sunne
abilities.text: If you have Lunala in play, your Solgaleo and Lunala take 50 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Armor of the Sunne Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Sol Fangs
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Togepi & Cleffa & Igglybuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rolling Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Supreme Puff-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) If this Pokémon has at least 14 extra Fairy Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), your opponent shuffles all of their Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to them into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Ninetales
data.flavorText: The reason it guides people all the way down to the mountain's base is that it wants them to hurry up and leave.

attacks.name: Rubbish Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile.

data.name: Floette
data.flavorText: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.

abilities.name: Flower Picking
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it's said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except p (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Flabébé
data.flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

attacks.name: Floral Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: This nuisance sneaks into people's homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.

attacks.name: Sneaky Pocket
attacks.text: Put a card from your hand in the Lost Zone. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except p (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Flabébé
data.flavorText: It's not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Florges
data.flavorText: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.

abilities.name: Flower Picking
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 2 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into their deck.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Swirlix
data.flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Slurpuff
data.flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

attacks.name: Olfactory Enchantment
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sweet Panic
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon isn't Confused, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash
data.flavorText: It runs across snow-covered plains at high speeds. It developed thick, sharp claws to plow through the snow.

attacks.name: Curve Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Reinforced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

attacks.name: Thumping Fall
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: A cunning and terrifying Pokémon, its cuteness makes opponents let down their guard—and then it swallows them whole with its huge jaws.

attacks.name: Dual Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

attacks.name: Doll Swap
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand. If you do, you may play Lillie's Poké Doll from your hand as your new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Azurill
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.

abilities.name: Growing Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Sylveon
data.flavorText: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Beloved Pulse
attacks.text: If you played a TAG TEAM Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Drampa
data.flavorText: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully's house and burn it to the ground.

attacks.name: Dragon Arcana
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 2 or more different types of basic Energy attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Hakamo-o
data.flavorText: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.

abilities.name: Fighter's Roar
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this Pokémon can evolve during the turn you play it.

data.name: Reshiram & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fabled Flarebolts
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 in any combination of basic Fire and basic Lightning Energy cards from your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Cross Break-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you played N's Resolve from your hand during this turn, this attack also does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's other Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jangmo-o
data.flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Jangmo-o
data.flavorText: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Igglybuff
data.flavorText: It's always practicing its singing because it wants to improve. Even when it's asleep, it keeps singing in its dreams!

abilities.name: Sleepy Voice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Aipom
data.flavorText: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.

abilities.name: Scampering Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put the top card of your opponent's deck on the bottom of their deck without looking at it.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

attacks.name: Follow My Tail
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Eevee and Eevee-GX and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Ambipom
data.flavorText: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.

attacks.name: Nice-Nice Catch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Throw
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

data.name: Rufflet
data.flavorText: With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck out their insides.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Braviary
data.flavorText: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it's considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aero Fall
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Heliolisk
data.flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

attacks.name: Parabolic Counter
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Lightning Pokémon in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn't run away as fast as possible.

abilities.name: Carry and Run
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Disk Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Silver Knight-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Erika
rules: Each player may draw up to 3 cards. You draw first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kommo-o
data.flavorText: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.

attacks.name: Shout of Power
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scaly Uppercut
attacks.text: You may discard a Pokémon Tool card from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Ultra Necrozma
data.flavorText: This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.

abilities.name: Ultra Burst
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't attack unless your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining.

attacks.name: Luster of Downfall
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Puffy Smashers-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Ursaring
data.flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.

attacks.name: Heavy Hold
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Zangoose
data.flavorText: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.

attacks.name: Brutal Edge
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can't defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.

attacks.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can't easily penetrate it.

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Type: Null
data.flavorText: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Bellelba & Brycen-Man
rules: Discard 3 cards from the top of each player's deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 3 other cards from your hand. If you do, each player discards their Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Benched Pokémon. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Clay
rules: Discard the top 7 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Item cards, put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Great Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.

abilities.name: Arf Arf Bark
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Chaotic Swell
rules: Whenever either player plays a Stadium card from their hand, discard that Stadium card after discarding this one. (The new Stadium card has no effect.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Solgaleo & Lunala-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cosmic Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Cosmic Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Light of the Protector-GX
attacks.text: If you played Lillie's Full Force from your hand during this turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to each of your Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Misty & Lorelei
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 5 other cards from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Water Pokémon can use their GX attacks even if you have used your GX attack.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Roxie
rules: Discard up to 2 Pokémon that aren't Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX from your hand. Draw 3 cards for each card you discarded in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ultimate Ray
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Altered Creation-GX
attacks.text: For the rest of this game, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), when your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from those attacks, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Arceus & Dialga & Palkia-GX

data.name: Naganadel & Guzzlord-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Violent Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Pokémon from your hand. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chaotic Order-GX
attacks.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy and 1 extra Darkness Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), take 2 Prize cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Mega Lopunny & Jigglypuff-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jumping Balloon
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.

attacks.name: Puffy Smashers-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If this Pokémon has at least 4 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: N's Resolve
rules: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are basic Energy cards, attach them to 1 of your Benched Dragon Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Red & Blue
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.)
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokémon you evolved in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rosa
rules: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.
Search your deck for a Pokémon, a Trainer card, and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

abilities.name: Blow-Away Bomb
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you discard this Pokémon with the effect of Roxie, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Place damage counters after the effect of Roxie.)

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 150 more damage.

attacks.name: Drill Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

attacks.name: Thumping Fall
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.

abilities.name: Arf Arf Bark
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dance of Tribute
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may draw 3 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dance of Tribute Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Strafe-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Silvally-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Disk Reload
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Silver Knight-GX
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, it is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Great Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Martial Arts Dojo
rules: The attacks of non-Ultra Beast Pokémon that have any basic Fighting Energy attached to them (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). If the attacking player has more Prize cards remaining than their opponent, those attacks do 40 more damage instead.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Lana's Fishing Rod
rules: Shuffle a Pokémon and a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Power Plant
rules: Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Draw Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
When you attach this card from your hand to a Pokémon, draw a card.

data.name: Giant Hearth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards, reveals them, and puts them into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Island Challenge Amulet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX this card is attached to gets -100 HP, and when it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie's Poké Doll
rules: Play this card as if it were a 30-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard all cards from it and put it on the bottom of your deck.
This card can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Tag Call
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 TAG TEAM cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
